title: Dad accused of smothering eight-week-old baby 'didn't know how her bones broke'
text:

A father accused of fatally smothering his eight-week-old baby daughter told police he had "no idea" how bones all over her body were broken.

Harper Denton was found purple and unresponsive on June 12 last year at the family home in Bedfordshire where she lived with Kevin Eves and her 34-year-old mum Cherinea Denton.

The 47-year-old dad told officers in his first police interview that he must have broken chest bones as he attempted to resuscitate his daughter.

He said he didn't know how the fractures in the rest of her body happened, Eves claimed in the interview transcript read out to a jury at the Old Bailey.

(Image: central news)

The interviewing officer, referring to an examination of Harper called a skeletal survey, said: "It's not given the cause of death and that's the one thing it hasn't done.

"What it's noticed, which is obviously a cause of serious concern, is Harper has numerous - and I'm not talking one or two - fractures.

"What I'm saying is they're all over her arms, her legs, her feet, her chest."

Replying in the interview, Eves said: "All the chest is obvious resuscitation isn't it? That's all I can explain for the chest."

But when asked about the other injuries on her tiny body he said: "I don't know, I can't tell you."

Earlier in today's proceedings the court heard extracts from the same interview in which Eves' spoke about waking up to find his daughter unconscious in her a moses basket beside the couple's bed.

Cherinea was said to be asleep on the sofa on the ground floor of the pair's council house.

(Image: Central News)

A neighbour claims to have seen her drive away from the home at 2am.

Eves said: "I looked over and I saw her in the cot and she was purple.

"I picked her up and quickly grabbed hold of her. I shouted to Cherinea and ran down the stairs.

"I'm saying she's not breathing and that's when we started resuscitating her. I had to stick my fingers down her throat to make sure her airways were clear.

"I blowed down her throat and started pumping her with my hands.

"Cherinea said I was doing it wrong. She was pushing with three fingers or something and doing it a lot lighter - she was doing so many pumps and pushing down on her."

Eves, of Wixams, Bedfordshire, denies murder and grievous bodily harm with intent.

The trial continues.
description: Kevin Eves is standing trial at the Old Bailey in London after Harper Denton was found dead at her family home in Bedfordshire
